title: QTL tally
text:
Code
base.geu <- "../code/results/qtl/noisy/Geuvadis/EUR/separateNoise/cis_100000/perm"
geu.sql.f <- glue("{base}/chr{chroms}.addQval.txt.gz", base = base.geu, chroms = 1:22)
names(geu.sql.f) <- glue("chr{1:22}")




Code
geu.sql <- map_dfr(geu.sql.f, fread)




Code
addLabels <- function(dt) {
  pid_split <- str_split(dt$phenotype_id, ":")
  dt$itype <- map_chr(pid_split, ~ .x[5])
  dt$clu <- map_chr(pid_split, ~ .x[4])
  dt$clu <- str_extract(dt$clu, "clu_[0-9]+")

  dt <- dt[, ctype := paste(sort(unique(itype)), collapse = ","), by = clu][]
  return(dt)
}




Code
geu.sql <- addLabels(geu.sql)




Code
geu.sql[1:2, ] %>% DT::datatable()








Number of introns


Code
geu.sql[, .N, by = itype
  ][, .(itype, N, P = N/sum(N)  )
  ][order(-N)]


   itype     N          P
1:    PR 83826 0.63891768
2:    UP 29665 0.22610518
3:    IN 11756 0.08960366
4:    NE  5953 0.04537348


Number of clusters


Code
geu.sql[, .(N = uniqueN(clu)), by = .(ctype)][, .(ctype, N, P = N/sum(N))][order(-N)]


          ctype     N            P
 1:          PR 21693 0.4992175634
 2:       PR,UP 14598 0.3359414553
 3:          IN  2943 0.0677267915
 4:       NE,PR  2154 0.0495696599
 5:    NE,PR,UP  1277 0.0293873982
 6:          UP   488 0.0112302665
 7:          NE    72 0.0016569246
 8:    IN,PR,UP    53 0.0012196806
 9:       IN,UP    43 0.0009895522
10:       IN,PR    38 0.0008744880
11:    IN,NE,PR    31 0.0007133981
12: IN,NE,PR,UP    22 0.0005062825
13:       IN,NE    20 0.0004602568
14:       NE,UP    17 0.0003912183
15:    IN,NE,UP     5 0.0001150642





Number of introns with FDR < 0.1


Code
FDR = params$fdr




Code
geu.sql[q < FDR, .N, by = .(itype)][, .(itype, N, P = N/sum(N))][order(-N)]


   itype    N          P
1:    PR 9092 0.54777684
2:    UP 3981 0.23984817
3:    IN 2690 0.16206772
4:    NE  835 0.05030727


Number of clusters with FDR < 0.1


Code
geu.sql[q < FDR, .(N = uniqueN(clu)), by = .(ctype)][, .(ctype, N, P = N/sum(N))][order(-N)]


          ctype    N            P
 1:       PR,UP 3391 0.4070828331
 2:          PR 2405 0.2887154862
 3:          IN  971 0.1165666267
 4:       NE,PR  700 0.0840336134
 5:    NE,PR,UP  642 0.0770708283
 6:          UP   86 0.0103241297
 7:    IN,PR,UP   27 0.0032412965
 8:       IN,PR   22 0.0026410564
 9:    IN,NE,PR   21 0.0025210084
10:       IN,UP   20 0.0024009604
11: IN,NE,PR,UP   17 0.0020408163
12:          NE   15 0.0018007203
13:       IN,NE    8 0.0009603842
14:       NE,UP    4 0.0004801921
15:    IN,NE,UP    1 0.0001200480





Number of introns satisfying FDR < 0.1 and from clusters of PR or PR,UP


Code
geu.sql[q < FDR & ctype %in% c("PR", "PR,UP"), .N, by = .(itype)][, .(itype, N, P = N/sum(N))][order(-N)]


   itype    N         P
1:    PR 6960 0.6886998
2:    UP 3146 0.3113002


Number of clusters satisfying FDR < 0.1 and from clusters of PR or PR,UP


Code
geu.sql[q < FDR & ctype %in% c("PR", "PR,UP"), .(N = uniqueN(clu)), by = .(ctype)][, .(ctype, N, P = N/sum(N))][order(-N)]


   ctype    N         P
1: PR,UP 3391 0.5850587
2:    PR 2405 0.4149413






For GTEx, use sQTLs from 49 tissues. We use FDR < 0.1 and cluster type PR or PR,UP to filter sQTLs.


Code
Tissues <- dir("../code/results/qtl/noisy/GTEx/")
Tissues <- Tissues[!Tissues %in% c("Bladder")]
names(Tissues) <- Tissues 
base1.gtex <- "../code/results/qtl/noisy/GTEx"
base2.gtex <- "/cis_100000/perm"
suffix <- "addQval.txt.gz"
# "../code/results/qtl/noisy/GTEx/Liver/separateNoise/cis_100000/perm/chr1.addQval.txt.gz"




Code
readGTExSQTL <- function(tissue) {
  base1.gtex <- "../code/results/qtl/noisy/GTEx/"
  base2.gtex <- "/cis_100000/perm"
  suffix <- "addQval.txt.gz"
  folder <- glue("{base1.gtex}/{tissue}/separateNoise{base2.gtex}")
  files <- glue("{folder}/chr{1:22}.{suffix}")
  dt <- map_dfr(files, fread)
}




Code
gtex.sqls <- readRDS("2024-06-10-gtex-sQTLs.rds")


Number of introns that satisfy FDR < 0.1 and from clusters of PR or PR,UP


Code
gtex.plot1.dt <- imap_dfr(gtex.sqls, \(x, y) {x[q < FDR & ctype %in% c("PR", "PR,UP"), .N, by = .(itype)][, .(tissue = y, itype, N, P = N/sum(N))][order(-N)]})





Code
gtex.plot1.dt %>% 
  ggplot() + geom_col(aes(x = forcats::fct_reorder(tissue, -N), y = N, fill = itype)) +
    scale_x_discrete(labels = function(x) str_wrap(str_replace_all(str_sub(x, 1, 40), "[\\-\\_]", " "), width = 20)) +
    labs(x = NULL, y = "Num. of sQTL introns", fill = NULL) + 
    theme_cowplot() +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1),
          legend.position = "top"
         )








Figure 1








Code
gtex.plot1.dt %>% DT::datatable()




Table 1










Number of clusters that satisfy FDR < 0.1 and from clusters of PR or PR,UP


Code
gtex.plot2.dt <- imap_dfr(gtex.sqls, \(x, y) {
  x[q < FDR & ctype %in% c("PR", "PR,UP"), .(N = uniqueN(clu)), by = .(ctype)][, .(tissue = y, ctype, N, P = N/sum(N))][order(-N)]
}
)





Code
gtex.plot2.dt %>% 
  ggplot() + geom_col(aes(x = forcats::fct_reorder(tissue, -N), y = N, fill = ctype)) +
    scale_x_discrete(labels = function(x) str_wrap(str_replace_all(str_sub(x, 1, 40), "[\\-\\_]", " "), width = 20)) +
    labs(x = NULL, y = "Num. of sQTL (cluster)", fill = NULL) + 
    theme_cowplot() +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1),
          legend.position = "top"
         )








Figure 2








Code
gtex.plot2.dt %>% DT::datatable()




Table 2

addLabels <- function(dt) {
  pid_split <- str_split(dt$phenotype_id, ":")
  dt$itype <- map_chr(pid_split, ~ .x[5])
  dt$clu <- map_chr(pid_split, ~ .x[4])
  dt$clu <- str_extract(dt$clu, "clu_[0-9]+")

  dt <- dt[, ctype := paste(sort(unique(itype)), collapse = ","), by = clu][]
  return(dt)
}

title: QTL tally
text:
For GTEx, use sQTLs from 49 tissues. We use FDR < 0.1 and cluster type PR or PR,UP to filter sQTLs.


Code
Tissues <- dir("../code/results/qtl/noisy/GTEx/")
Tissues <- Tissues[!Tissues %in% c("Bladder")]
names(Tissues) <- Tissues 
base1.gtex <- "../code/results/qtl/noisy/GTEx"
base2.gtex <- "/cis_100000/perm"
suffix <- "addQval.txt.gz"
# "../code/results/qtl/noisy/GTEx/Liver/separateNoise/cis_100000/perm/chr1.addQval.txt.gz"




Code
readGTExSQTL <- function(tissue) {
  base1.gtex <- "../code/results/qtl/noisy/GTEx/"
  base2.gtex <- "/cis_100000/perm"
  suffix <- "addQval.txt.gz"
  folder <- glue("{base1.gtex}/{tissue}/separateNoise{base2.gtex}")
  files <- glue("{folder}/chr{1:22}.{suffix}")
  dt <- map_dfr(files, fread)
}




Code
gtex.sqls <- readRDS("2024-06-10-gtex-sQTLs.rds")


Number of introns that satisfy FDR < 0.1 and from clusters of PR or PR,UP


Code

  ggplot() + geom_col(aes(x = forcats::fct_reorder(tissue, -N), y = N, fill = itype)) +
    scale_x_discrete(labels = function(x) str_wrap(str_replace_all(str_sub(x, 1, 40), "[\\-\\_]", " "), width = 20)) +
    labs(x = NULL, y = "Num. of sQTL introns", fill = NULL) + 
    theme_cowplot() +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1),
          legend.position = "top"
         )
